verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Solomon had finished the building of the house of the LORD, and the king’s house, and all Solomon’s desire which he was pleased to do,
verses.ct: After Solomon had completed construction of the LORD's temple, the royal palace, and every other project he had wanted to accomplish,

verses.kjv: That the LORD appeared to Solomon the second time, as he had appeared unto him at Gibeon.
verses.ct: the LORD appeared to Solomon a 2nd time, just as he had appeared to him at Gibeon.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, I have heard thy prayer and thy supplication, that thou hast made before me: I have hallowed this house, which thou hast built, to put my name there for ever; and mine eyes and mine heart shall be there perpetually.
verses.ct: The LORD told him, "I have heard your prayer and your plea that you brought before me. I have set apart this temple that you built, placing my name there permanently. My attention and my devotion will remain there always.

verses.kjv: And if thou wilt walk before me, as David thy father walked, in integrity of heart, and in uprightness, to do according to all that I have commanded thee, and wilt keep my statutes and my judgments:
verses.ct: As for you, if you live in my presence the way your father David did — with an honest heart and moral integrity — doing everything I have commanded you and obeying my laws and regulations,

verses.kjv: Then I will establish the throne of thy kingdom upon Israel for ever, as I promised to David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man upon the throne of Israel.
verses.ct: then I will secure your royal dynasty over Israel permanently, just as I promised your father David when I said, 'You will never lack a descendant on the throne of Israel.'

verses.kjv: But if ye shall at all turn from following me, ye or your children, and will not keep my commandments and my statutes which I have set before you, but go and serve other gods, and worship them:
verses.ct: But if you or your descendants turn away from following me and refuse to obey the commands and laws I have given you, and instead go off to serve and worship other gods,

verses.kjv: Then will I cut off Israel out of the land which I have given them; and this house, which I have hallowed for my name, will I cast out of my sight; and Israel shall be a proverb and a byword among all people:
verses.ct: then I will remove Israel from the land I gave them, and this temple that I set apart for my name — I will reject it. Israel will become an object of ridicule and mockery among every nation.

verses.kjv: And at this house, which is high, every one that passeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss; and they shall say, Why hath the LORD done thus unto this land, and to this house?
verses.ct: This temple, as impressive as it is, will shock everyone who passes by it. They will gasp and ask, 'Why has the LORD done this to this land and this temple?'

verses.kjv: And they shall answer, Because they forsook the LORD their God, who brought forth their fathers out of the land of Egypt, and have taken hold upon other gods, and have worshipped them, and served them: therefore hath the LORD brought upon them all this evil.
verses.ct: And the answer will be, 'Because they abandoned the LORD their God, who brought their ancestors out of Egypt. They clung to other gods, worshiping and serving them. That is why the LORD brought all this disaster on them.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of twenty years, when Solomon had built the two houses, the house of the LORD, and the king’s house,
verses.ct: At the end of 20 years, during which Solomon had constructed the two buildings — the LORD's temple and the royal palace —

verses.kjv: (Now Hiram the king of Tyre had furnished Solomon with cedar trees and fir trees, and with gold, according to all his desire,) that then king Solomon gave Hiram twenty cities in the land of Galilee.
verses.ct: King Hiram of Tyre had supplied Solomon with cedar logs, cypress logs, and gold — as much as he wanted. In return, King Solomon gave Hiram 20 towns in the region of Galilee.

verses.kjv: And Hiram came out from Tyre to see the cities which Solomon had given him; and they pleased him not.
verses.ct: But when Hiram traveled from Tyre to inspect the towns Solomon had given him, he was not impressed.

verses.kjv: And he said, What cities are these which thou hast given me, my brother? And he called them the land of Cabul unto this day.
verses.ct: He said, "What kind of towns are these that you've given me, my brother?" So he named that area the land of Cabul, and it's still called that today.

verses.kjv: And Hiram sent to the king sixscore talents of gold.
verses.ct: Hiram had sent the king 120 talents of gold.

verses.kjv: And this is the reason of the levy which king Solomon raised; for to build the house of the LORD, and his own house, and Millo, and the wall of Jerusalem, and Hazor, and Megiddo, and Gezer.
verses.ct: Here is the account of the forced labor that King Solomon conscripted to build the LORD's temple, his own palace, the Millo, the wall of Jerusalem, and the cities of Hazor, Megiddo, and Gezer.

verses.kjv: For Pharaoh king of Egypt had gone up, and taken Gezer, and burnt it with fire, and slain the Canaanites that dwelt in the city, and given it for a present unto his daughter, Solomon’s wife.
verses.ct: Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, had attacked and captured Gezer, burned it down, and killed the Canaanites living there. Then he gave it as a wedding gift to his daughter, Solomon's wife.

verses.kjv: And Solomon built Gezer, and Bethhoron the nether,
verses.ct: Solomon rebuilt Gezer along with Lower Beth-horon,

verses.kjv: And Baalath, and Tadmor in the wilderness, in the land,
verses.ct: Baalath, and Tadmor in the wilderness within the land,

verses.kjv: And all the cities of store that Solomon had, and cities for his chariots, and cities for his horsemen, and that which Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.
verses.ct: as well as all his storage cities, the cities for his chariots, the cities for his cavalry, and whatever else Solomon wanted to build in Jerusalem, in Lebanon, and throughout his entire kingdom.

verses.kjv: And all the people that were left of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, which were not of the children of Israel,
verses.ct: All the remaining people from the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites — those who were not Israelites —

verses.kjv: Their children that were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel also were not able utterly to destroy, upon those did Solomon levy a tribute of bondservice unto this day.
verses.ct: their descendants who still remained in the land, whom the Israelites had been unable to completely wipe out — Solomon conscripted them into forced labor, and they remain so to this day.

verses.kjv: But of the children of Israel did Solomon make no bondmen: but they were men of war, and his servants, and his princes, and his captains, and rulers of his chariots, and his horsemen.
verses.ct: However, Solomon did not make any Israelites into forced laborers. Instead, they served as his soldiers, officials, commanders, officers, and chariot and cavalry leaders.

verses.kjv: These were the chief of the officers that were over Solomon’s work, five hundred and fifty, which bare rule over the people that wrought in the work.
verses.ct: The chief supervisors overseeing Solomon's projects numbered 550. They directed the workers carrying out the construction.

verses.kjv: But Pharaoh’s daughter came up out of the city of David unto her house which Solomon had built for her: then did he build Millo.
verses.ct: Once Pharaoh's daughter moved from the City of David into the palace Solomon had built for her, he then constructed the Millo.

verses.kjv: And three times in a year did Solomon offer burnt offerings and peace offerings upon the altar which he built unto the LORD, and he burnt incense upon the altar that was before the LORD. So he finished the house.
verses.ct: 3 times each year, Solomon presented burnt offerings and peace offerings on the altar he had built for the LORD, and he burned incense on the altar in the LORD's presence. In this way, he fulfilled all the obligations of the temple.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon made a navy of ships in Eziongeber, which is beside Eloth, on the shore of the Red sea, in the land of Edom.
verses.ct: King Solomon also assembled a fleet of ships at Ezion-geber, which is near Eloth on the coast of the Red Sea in the territory of Edom.

verses.kjv: And Hiram sent in the navy his servants, shipmen that had knowledge of the sea, with the servants of Solomon.
verses.ct: Hiram sent experienced sailors from his own workforce to serve in the fleet alongside Solomon's men.

verses.kjv: And they came to Ophir, and fetched from thence gold, four hundred and twenty talents, and brought it to king Solomon.
verses.ct: They sailed to Ophir and brought back 420 talents of gold, which they delivered to King Solomon.
